Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @heguli97 this is the xtn that explodes current `hushd` : https://gist.github.com/leto/0e28afba1ed1298564f1f829b7cd34c6

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I had to write custom Hush code to dump info to even figure that out

Author: Gateway#3763
Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> that patch helped to give the data of which xtn kerplodes

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> and then i finally realized what was causing it, and reported to James/KMD folks

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> To make it even more interesting, only nodes where *were not online at the time of the problematic block* coredump!!!!

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> All nodes which saw the xtn in their mempool, i.e. were online, did not coredump

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Only nodes which have to "sync thru" that block coredump

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> this is why it singled out GUI wallet users so much, because they are most likely to start/stop their node often

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <heguli97> I had a suspicion that online nodes didn't experience the problem since all pools, explorers, exchanges and some community members didn't report any issues

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <phm87> I am happy that the pb was identified

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <scubapanda> Viewingkey already implemented in zec?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> not fully merged into zcash.git master, but seems close-ish

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> the PR is almost 1 year old

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> zecwallet-lite might have used some of that code, not sure

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> https://github.com/zcash/zcash/pull/3822

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> that PR has been merged into KMD world a long time

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> by radix42

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <scubapanda> It will be really interesting to learn why they didn't implement it in the first place.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> very deep reasonable reasons

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> TLDR: it gives up privacy, to ask a 3rd party server for *just* the xtns or blocks that you have xtns in

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> with taddrs, there is no privacy

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> but using an electrum-like server, with zaddrs, is different

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> so zecwalletlite has done something new and interesting

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> so asking a server for the memo data from xtns 34544,45454,45456263, that is no good. you have to ask for large %'s of the chain

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> to disguise what data you care about

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> so it's deep reasons, not that Zcash was being unreasonable

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <scubapanda> Ok, interesting but how does that relate to users running a full node and wanting to use viewingkey? It was in the specs and so far not implemented in zec? If there is nothing wrong with the implementation of the viewingkey (used in KMD for example), why doesn't zec just include it (or their version of course) in their code?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <scubapanda> This is last I read. https://github.com/zcash/zcash/issues/3060

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> zec has opinions about tests and test coverage and test suites

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> KMD and HUSH do not share these same opinions

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @scubapanda fyi the PR i linked is an updated version of 3060. it's all about importing/exporting them, in a format that zcash likes and is "official". KMD/Hush just want something that works and so we just merged it and mess with it

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Pirate will requires zaddr viewkeys to implement many things, such as zaddr atomic swaps, zaddr smart contracts, etc...

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> zaddr viewkeys are extremely important for many applications

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> https://medium.com/@jameslee777/cross-chain-atomic-swaps-using-a-private-transaction-only-chain-like-pirate-9679d636b392

Content: [dscrd-hush] <scubapanda> Thanks again, I'll read and learn!

Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @jl777c has written about it a bunch, but it's all still very much in flux. The next few months will see many new interesting things in Zcash World, I am sure
